name: SmoothDisplacementField
description:
Advanced Normalization Tools (ANTs) is a C++ library available through the command line that computes high-dimensional mappings to capture the statistics of brain structure and function. It allows one to organize, visualize and statistically explore large biomedical image sets. Additionally, it integrates imaging modalities in space + time and works across species or organ systems with minimal customization.

The ANTs library is considered a state-of-the-art medical image registration and segmentation toolkit which depends on the Insight ToolKit, a widely used medical image processing library to which ANTs developers contribute. ANTs-related tools have also won several international, unbiased competitions such as MICCAI, BRATS, and STACOM.
author: ANTs developers

inputs.name: Image Dimension
inputs.description: The dimensionality of the input displacement field.

inputs.name: Output Field
inputs.description: The output file for the smoothed displacement field.

inputs.name: Variance or Mesh Size Base Level
inputs.description: The variance for Gaussian smoothing or mesh size at the base level for B-spline smoothing.

inputs.name: Number of Levels
inputs.description: The number of levels for multi-resolution smoothing.

inputs.name: Spline Order
inputs.description: The order of the spline for B-spline smoothing.

inputs.name: Estimate Inverse
inputs.description: Estimate the inverse of the displacement field if set to 1.

inputs.name: Confidence Image
inputs.description: Optional confidence image output of the smoothing process.

output-files.name: Smoothed Field
output-files.description: The output file containing the smoothed displacement field.

output-files.name: Confidence Image Output
output-files.description: The output file containing confidence information from the smoothing process.
